revised_title: Max Weber's Life and Contributions to Zoology
tldr: The article is an obituary for Max Weber, a prominent zoologist and comparative anatomist. Weber made significant contributions to the study of zoology, including extensive research on marine life, freshwater fauna, and geographical distribution. He conducted numerous expeditions to various locations, such as the Dutch East Indies, and authored a textbook on mammalia. His work spanned various fields, from studying the anatomy of different species to collecting ethnographical materials.
